channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
item.description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a flexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields? Biology Biomedical Engineering Chemistry Chemical Engineering Computer Engineering Computer Science Design Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Physics If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America's Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on December 11 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.

item.title: 17th annual USPTO-GIPC IP attaché roundtable
item.description: The 17th annual IP attaché roundtable, hosted by the U.S. Chamber of Commerce's Global Innovation Policy Center (GIPC), will feature presentations by each of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) intellectual property (IP) attachés. A question-and-answer session will follow the presentations. The program will provide a unique opportunity to participate in an in-depth discussion of recent trends and challenges in IP protection and enforcement around the world. This in-person event is free and open to public. However, space is limited, so advance registration is required.Learn more about the USPTO's IP Attaché Program.Register todayAdditional informationFor more information, go to the registration page. For non-press inquiries, please contact Terri Davis at the USPTO's Office of Policy and International Affairs, or Kelly Anderson at the Global Innovation Policy Center.

item.title: Getting started with Patent Public Search
item.description: Are you puzzled by patent searching or confused by the patent searching options available on the internet? Whether you are a novice searcher or an experienced one, the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) is here to help.

item.title: Virtual office hour with USPTO patent examiners
item.description: Calling all scientists and engineers!Seeking a career at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner? If you are a U.S. citizen and are graduating this year with a focus in…BiologyBiomedical EngineeringChemistryChemical EngineeringComputer EngineeringComputer ScienceDesignElectrical EngineeringMechanical EngineeringPhysics …then bring your questions about the agency, the role, and the hiring process to this informal Q&A session with current USPTO patent examiners on January 10, at noon ET. Our team members are excited to answer your questions, chat with you, and provide you with more information about this opportunity. Join sessionYou do not need to register for this event but come prepared with any questions you may have. We hope to see you there! For more information, contact recruitment@uspto.gov. When you are ready to apply, submit your application via USAJOBS.

item.title: A fireside chat with USPTO patent examiners
item.description: Come join us for a laid back and informational fireside chat that will give you an inside look at being a patent examiner at the USPTO. You will get the opportunity to engage in insightful conversations and get answers to your questions directly from team members.
